block.p: Starting his second four-year term as Mayor of New York, Rudolph W. Giuliani replayed themes that re-elected him and propelled him to national prominence. He promised to hire more police officers because ''first and foremost as our city enters the 21st century, we have to build on what has worked for us, and what has turned us around.'' The inauguration began a year-long celebration of the centennial of Greater New York.
